item.description:
The Wolf Hill Trail and Forest Preserve is a pleasant area that has lots of ancient stone walls, white birch and red cedar trees, lots of ponds and streams and undulating hills.

Along the hike there are points where you can see Narragansett Bay. The hike will take us to the memorial site of a WWII plane crash and to Mercer Outlook where on a clear day you can see Providence and even the Newport Bridge. The trails are moderately strenuous with a few hills.

 We'll hike 3 miles for 2-3 hours.

Please be sure to bring plenty of water, dress in layers, the first not being cotton. Also bring lunch or snacks for muching along the way.

We'll wait 10 minutes so if your running late, please call. 508-415-0590

Trail Map

Directions: Take exit 7B off Route 295 on to Route 44 West. Turn right on to Cedar Swamp Road/Route 5 north. Turn right onto Route 116 North - Pleasant View Ave. Go for approximately 1.5 miles. Turn right on to Waterview Drive just past the Smithfield Police station. Conservation Center entrance will be on your right just across from the Wolf Hill Trail head. Lot is right behind police station.
item.how_to_find_us: Parking area behind Smithfield Police Station - see description
item.name: Hike at Wolf Hill Trail
